abstract: The offer by Robin Yanhong Li, Baidu’s chairman, and Yu Gong, Qiyi’s chief executive, would value Qiyi.com at about $2.8 billion
snippet: The offer by Robin Yanhong Li, Baidu’s chairman, and Yu Gong, Qiyi’s chief executive, would value Qiyi.com at about $2.8 billion
lead_paragraph: Baidu, China’s equivalent of Google, said Friday that it had received a nonbinding proposal to acquire its majority stake in the Chinese video streaming website Qiyi.com, valuing the business at about $2.8 billion.

headline.main: Baidu Receives Offer for Stake in Online Video Platform Qiyi
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Baidu Receives Offer for Stake in Video Platform Qiyi
